p: Recently, the antiparasitic activity of BRP has attracted the attention of researchers. Polymeric nanoparticles of the BRP extract and the ethanolic extract of BRP have demonstrated anti-leishmanial activity against L. (V. ) braziliensis, with IC 50 values of 31.3 μg/mL and 38.0 μg/mL, respectively, demonstrating the potential of BRP in the composition of pharmaceuticals for leishmaniasis therapy [ 12]. Additionally, when ethanolic extracts from various types of green, brown and red propolis from different regions of Brazil were tested against Trypanosoma cruzi Y-strain epimastigotes, an inhibitory effect on parasite growth was observed in the first 24 h for all the types of propolis. However, only the ethanolic extracts of BRP presented a persistent T. cruzi-inhibitory effect after 96 h, suggesting red propolis as a potential alternative for the therapeutic treatment of Chagas disease [ 10].
